text: Oh wow, this is giving me the biggest Dragon Quest Monsters vibe ever. Didn't surprise me that Sugiyama had his hands in both.
author: SeriousKano

text:
I love this game so much.
A shame that after the mid part, the game gets difficult as hell.
Bosses 2-hit killing you or a ton of grinding near the end makes this game exhausting and even frustrating.
But man, I still love this game.
It's also really nostalgic to me.

text: I've always wanted to play this. Its so pricey now! : (
author: daneofurexistence

text: Very charming RPG/platforming hybrid with excellent music by Sugiyama. It's always interesting to listen to music he composed outside of the Dragon Quest series. This game especially has music that could have come straight out of DQ. The game itself is a lot of fun and quite innovative, very refreshing.
author: SupraDarky

text: Wow, it would look just like Spore if it was storyless, 3-D, and filled with bugs! I'm definitely looking into it, though from the gameplay I've seen, I really don't appreciate the fact that it resets your character after every segment.
author: Jirt

text: Yeah ! Sugiyama is my favorite composer ever ! Can definitely hear his style in some of the chords progression. Even though I prefer his Dragon's Quest stuff :)
author: Louis Claudel

text:
@Mdude360
It resets your character after each segment because you EVOLVE. You then need to ADAPT to the changes of evolution again. That's the biggest reason of that mechanic. It's like Darwin's Law.
author: Faldomar

text: @Mdude360 There's an interesting feature that counters that. You can save your evolutions as they are in an evolution slot. Then, whenever you have a green crystal you can spend it to become any evolution you have saved (including some secret, one-of-a-kind ones...). I don't exactly remember if it was the green crystal though.
author: Zenju

text: @Mdude360 That is what I said to my brother, because I want he to try it n_n
